question: 1. When replicating data from a primary RDS instance to a secondary one, how much will you be charged, in relation to the standard data transfer charge?
options: A. Your data will be transferred at the standard data transfer charge.
D. There is no charge for primary-to-secondary data replication.
B. Your data will be transferred at half of the standard data transfer charge.
C. Your data will be transferred at half of the standard data transfer charge up to 1 GB of transfer per day and then additional data at the standard data transfer charge.
answers: D. There is no charge for primary-to-secondary data replication.

question: 2. Which of the following are valid options for where an RDS read replica is set up in relation to the primary instance? (Choose two.)
options: D. Both A and B
A. In the same region as the primary instance
B. In a separate region from the primary instance
C. In an instance running on premises
answers: D. Both A and B
C. In an instance running on premises

question: 3. What is the primary purpose of a read replica RDS configuration?
options: D. Security
A. Disaster recovery
B. Fault tolerance
C. Performance
answers: C. Performance

question: 4. Which of the following databases support read replicas?
options: D. All of the above
A. MariaDB
B. MySQL
C. PostgreSQL
answers: D. All of the above

question: 5. Which of the following databases support read replicas?
options: A. Oracle
C. DynamoDB
B. MySQL
D. All of the above
answers: A. Oracle
B. MySQL

question: 6. Which of the following is true about a read replica? (Choose two.)
options: B. It can only exist in the same region as the primary database, although it can be in a different availability zone.
C. It is updated via asynchronous replication from the primary instance.
D. It is updated via synchronous replication from the primary instance.
A. It is a read-only instance of a primary database.
answers: C. It is updated via asynchronous replication from the primary instance.
A. It is a read-only instance of a primary database.

question: 7. Which of the following is true about an RDS read replica configuration? (Choose two.)
options: D. A read replica can exist in a different region than the primary instance.
A. Only three read replicas can be set up for a single primary database instance.
B. Only MariaDB, MySQL, and Aurora are supported.
C. A read replica replicates all databases in the primary instance.
answers: D. A read replica can exist in a different region than the primary instance.
C. A read replica replicates all databases in the primary instance.

question: 8. You have a primary database set up to use read replicas running on an instance in US East 1. You have three read replicas also in US East 1 and two additional replicas in US West 2. You are trying to create a new replica in EU West 1 and are getting an error. What do you need to do to resolve this error and successfully create a new read replica in EU West 1?
options: D. Turn off one of the read replicas in US East 1 and then you can create the instance in EU West 1.
B. You can’t create the replica in EU West 1. Instead, create the replica in another US region to avoid regulations about read replicas in the EU.
A. Turn on the Multi-AZ option for your primary instance.
C. Contact AWS about raising the number of read replicas allowed from 5 to 8.
answers: D. Turn off one of the read replicas in US East 1 and then you can create the instance in EU West 1.

question: 9. Which of the following are true about a read replica setup? (Choose two.)
options: C. They can exist within a single AZ, cross-AZ, or cross-region.
D. A read replica can be promoted to a stand-alone database instance.
B. They provide a highly scalable solution for your on-premises databases.
A. Backups are configured by default when you set up read replicas.
answers: D. A read replica can be promoted to a stand-alone database instance.
C. They can exist within a single AZ, cross-AZ, or cross-region.

question: 10. Which of the following are true about a read replica setup? (Choose two.)
options: C. Each read replica instance can upgrade its database engine separate from the primary instance.
A. Automated backups are taken from the read replicas rather than the primary instance.
B. The database engine on all instances is active.
D. Replication is synchronous.
answers: C. Each read replica instance can upgrade its database engine separate from the primary instance.
B. The database engine on all instances is active.

question: 11. Which of the following statements are false? (Choose two.)
options: C. A single database can both have a read replica and be part of a Multi-AZ setup.
B. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations provide disaster recovery options for your primary instance.
A. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations ensure that you have database instances in multiple availability zones.
D. A read replica can be promoted to be a stand-alone database instance.
answers: B. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations provide disaster recovery options for your primary instance.
A. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations ensure that you have database instances in multiple availability zones.

question: 12. Which of the following statements is true?
options: B. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations are aimed at fault tolerance.
A. A Multi-AZ setup is aimed at fault tolerance, while a read replica setup is aimed at scalability.
C. A Multi-AZ setup is aimed at scalability, while a read replica setup is aimed at fault tolerance.
D. Both read replicas and Multi-AZ configurations are aimed at scalability.
answers: A. A Multi-AZ setup is aimed at fault tolerance, while a read replica setup is aimed at scalability.

question: 13. How do applications communicate with read replica instances?
options: A. Through the read replica REST API provided by RDS
C. Each read replica provides a read replica key that allows applications to communicate with the instance as if it were a normal database instance.
D. Applications communicate with a read replica exactly as they would with a non-read replica.
B. ELBs and ALBs will automatically translate requests to a read replica to use the read replica REST API provided by RDS.
answers: D. Applications communicate with a read replica exactly as they would with a non-read replica.

question: 14. Which of the following are valid reasons to use read replication? (Choose two.)
options: A. You have a read-heavy database that is peaking in traffic.
D. You have a large number of business reporting queries that are currently interfering with customer application performance.
B. You have a large number of errors reported by applications trying to update user entries in your current database and want to reduce these errors.
C. You want an automated disaster recovery solution in case you lose an AZ.
answers: A. You have a read-heavy database that is peaking in traffic.
D. You have a large number of business reporting queries that are currently interfering with customer application performance.

question: 15. Does a read replica provide any assistance at all in creating a fault-tolerant database setup?
options: C. Yes, if the primary instance fails, one of the replicas will be automatically promoted to a stand-alone database instance.
B. Yes, if the primary instance fails, one of the replicas can be manually promoted to a stand-alone database instance.
D. No
A. Yes, it provides automated backups to the read replicas.
answers: B. Yes, if the primary instance fails, one of the replicas can be manually promoted to a stand-alone database instance.

question: 16. Which of the following are valid reasons to use read replication? (Choose two.)
options: C. Your boss has asked for an automated backup solution that takes advantage of AWS managed services.
A. You have customers in a region geographically distant from your primary instance and want to improve their read performance when they access your applications hosted in regions closer to them.
B. Your current database instance is showing memory saturation with current traffic loads.
D. You need to perform additional OLTP queries and want to improve the performance of those queries.
answers: A. You have customers in a region geographically distant from your primary instance and want to improve their read performance when they access your applications hosted in regions closer to them.
B. Your current database instance is showing memory saturation with current traffic loads.

question: 17. Can you configure a database instance to be both a read replica and a primary database instance for the original instance?
options: C. Yes, as long as the instances are not in the same availability zone.
A. Yes, as long as the instances are all in the same availability zone.
B. Yes, if you turn on circular replication in both primary database instances.
D. No, AWS does not support circular replication.
answers: D. No, AWS does not support circular replication.

question: 18. In which of the following ways can you create a read replica? (Choose two.)
options: C. Through the AWS API
B. Through the AWS online support system
A. Through the AWS console
D. Through Elastic Beanstalk
answers: C. Through the AWS API
A. Through the AWS console

question: 19. How are automated backups related to read replicas?
options: A. They are not; read replicas and automated backups have no relationship at all.
B. Read replicas do not create automatic backups, but the primary database instance must have automatic backups enabled to create read replicas.
C. Read replicas cause the primary database instance to automatically begin backing up.
D. Each read replica is automatically backed up after an initial read from the primary database instance.
answers: B. Read replicas do not create automatic backups, but the primary database instance must have automatic backups enabled to create read replicas.

question: 20. Can a database instance be a read replica of one database and the source instance for another read replica?
options: D. Yes, as long as you enable circular replication on both databases.
A. Yes, as long as the source and replicant database are not the same instance.
B. No, a database cannot be both a read replica and a source database.
C. Yes, as long as the source and replicant database are in the same availability zone.
answers: A. Yes, as long as the source and replicant database are not the same instance.
